thread.title: NBA Preseason: Memphis remains perfect while Cleveland is still winless
thread.title_full: NBA Preseason: Memphis remains perfect while Cleveland is still winless | Examiner.com

author: Daniel Benjamin
title: NBA Preseason: Memphis remains perfect while Cleveland is still winless
text:
Play Memphis Grizzlies-Minnesota Timberwolves preseason action Oct. 19 youtube.com There are just a few days left in the NBA preseason but there are a couple of trends that remained the same. These trends is that the Memphis Grizzlies may be one of the teams to watch this season while the Cleveland Cavaliers have a lot of work to do -- at the very least they need to get healthy.
The Grizzlies improved to 5-0 in the preseason with a 90-68 victory over the Minnesota Timberwolves as Courtney Lee tallied 18 points, on 6-of-12 shooting including 3-of-4 from beyonf the arc. Tony Allen added 13 points while Marc Gasol and Mike Conley each contributed 12 points apiece.
Memphis rested Jeff Green, Matt Barnes, Brendan Wright, Beno Udrih and Vince Carter. Jarell Martin and Jordan Adams also didn't suit up as they are recovering from injuries.
Gorgui Deng led Minnesota (1-4) with 12 points and seven rebounds. No. 1 overall pick Karl Anthony-Towns had eight points and seven caroms while Ricky Rubio was scoreless in his first action of the preseason.
Nikola Pekovic (Achilles), Tyus Jones, Andre Miller, Lorenzo Brown and Kevin Martin didn't play for the Wolves.
In other action on Sunday:
Kevin Love returned to the court for the first time since Boston Celtics forward/center Kelly Olynyk pulled his shoulder out from the socket but the Cleveland Cavaliers still fell to 0-6 this preseason with a 87-81 loss to the Toronto Raptors. Love scored six points, on 2-of-7 shooting, and hauled in four rebounds in 13 minutes of action. Mo Williams led the way for the Cavs with 13 points and seven boards while Matthew Delladova (12 points, 5 assists), Anderson Vareajo (12 points, 6 rebounds, 5 dimes) and Jared Cunningham (10 points) also reached double-figures. Cleveland was without LeBron James and Richard Jefferson for the game as both rested.
Jonas Valanciunas led the way for Toronto (4-2) with 12 points while Cory Joseph added 11 points and six assists.
Brook Lopez scored a preseason-high 24 points and Thaddeus Young produced a double-double (15 points, 10 rebounds) to lead Brooklyn (2-3) past Philadelphia 92-91. Nerlens Noel had 15 points and 11 rebounds and Jahlil Okafor finished with 14 points and five rebounds for the 76ers (2-4). Okafor and Jamal Sampson were restricted to 20 minutes of action.
Several players did not play for each team as Joel Embiid, Nik Stauskas, Tony Wroten, Kendall Marshall, Carl Landry, Jerami Grant and Christian Wood did not dress for Philadelphia. Markel Brown (left oblique strain), Andrea Bargnani (tight left hamstring) and Chris McCullough (right knee rehab) did not dress for Brooklyn.
San Antonio (1-3)nearly blew a 24-point lead but held on to earn its first victory of the preseason with a 96-92 victory over Detroit. Kawhi Leonard led the way for the Spurs with 21 points and Manu Ginobili came off the bench and chipped in 15 points. San Antonio finished the game 10-of-20 from three-point range. Reggie Jackson led Detroit (2-4) with 20 points and nine assists. Andre Drummond added 10 points and 13 caroms while Ersan Ilyasova contributed 14 points and Marcus Morris had 10 points.
Gerald Green and James Ennis each tallied 19 points as the Miami Heat (3-3) dealt the Atlanta Hawks (4-1) their first defeat of the season. Mike Scott led the way for Atlanta with 19 points. The Oklahoma City Thunder (4-1) looked in midseason form in their 111-98 victory over the Denver Nuggets (4-2). Kevin Durant, who saw a preseason-high 32 minutes of action, scored 23 points on 9-of-14 shooting. Serge Ibaka (18 points), Enes Kantner (18 points, 11 caroms), Russell Westbrook (17 points, 12 assists, five rebounds) and Dion Waiters (17 points) are reached double-figures. Steven Adams had eight points and four rebounds for the Thunder before leaving the game in the third quarter after getting poked in the eye.
Rookie Emmanual Mudiay pumped in 22 points to lead the Nuggets, who got 16 points each from Danilo Gallinari and Erick Green.
Damian Lillard scored 32 points, C.J. McCollum had 26 and the Portland Trail Blazers (3-2) rallied from a 21-point, second-half deficit to beat the Utah Jazz 116-111 in overtime. Trey Burke scored 22 points and Joe Ingles came off the bench to hit five 3-pointers scored 16 points for Utah (2-3).
